targets.expr: $func(rate(scylla_io_queue_consumption{iogroup=~"$iogroup", class=~"$classes", instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc"}[$__rate_interval])) by (instance, iogroup, stream)

panels.description:
This graph shows how IO queue consumption is distributed between io-groups and streams.

scylla_io_queue_consumption
panels.title: I/O Group consumption by instance

targets.expr: topk([[topk]], scylla_io_queue_flow_ratio{iogroup=~"$iogroup", instance=~"[[node]]", cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}) or on ([[by]]) bottomk([[bottomk]], scylla_io_queue_flow_ratio{iogroup=~"$iogroup", instance=~"[[node]]", cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"})

panels.description:
This graph shows the ratio of dispatch rate to completion rate. It is expected to be 1.0, growing larger on reactor stalls or disk problems.

scylla_io_queue_flow_ratio
panels.title: I/O Group Queue flow ratio

targets.expr: topk([[topk]], max(rate(scylla_io_queue_total_delay_sec{class="$classes", instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])/rate(scylla_io_queue_total_operations{class="$classes", instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]]) or on() max(scylla_io_queue_delay{class="$classes", instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"} ) by ([[by]])) or on ([[by]]) bottomk([[bottomk]], max(rate(scylla_io_queue_total_delay_sec{class="$classes", instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])/rate(scylla_io_queue_total_operations{class="$classes", instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]]) or on() max(scylla_io_queue_delay{class="$classes", instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"} ) by ([[by]]))

panels.description: scylla_io_queue_total_delay_sec
panels.title: $classes I/O Queue delay by [[by]]

targets.expr: topk([[topk]], max(scylla_io_queue_queue_length{class="$classes", instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}) by ([[by]])) or on ([[by]]) bottomk([[bottomk]], max(scylla_io_queue_queue_length{class="$classes", instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}) by ([[by]]))

panels.description: scylla_io_queue_queue_length
panels.title: $classes Queue length by [[by]]

targets.expr: topk([[topk]], sum(rate(scylla_io_queue_total_bytes{class="$classes", instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]])) or on ([[by]]) bottomk([[bottomk]], sum(rate(scylla_io_queue_total_bytes{class="$classes", instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]]))

panels.description:
The queue bandwidth rate in bytes 

scylla_io_queue_total_bytes
panels.title: $classes I/O Queue bandwidth by [[by]]

targets.expr: topk([[topk]], sum(rate(scylla_io_queue_total_operations{class="$classes", instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]])) or on ([[by]]) bottomk([[bottomk]], sum(rate(scylla_io_queue_total_operations{class="$classes", instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]]))

panels.description:
The rate of io queue operation

sscylla_io_queue_total_operations
panels.title: $classes I/O Queue IOPS by [[by]]

targets.expr: topk([[topk]], max(rate(scylla_io_queue_total_exec_sec{class="$classes", instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])/rate(scylla_io_queue_total_operations{class="$classes", instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]]) or on() max(scylla_io_queue_delay{class="$classes", instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"} ) by ([[by]])) or on ([[by]]) bottomk([[bottomk]], max(rate(scylla_io_queue_total_exec_sec{class="$classes", instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])/rate(scylla_io_queue_total_operations{class="$classes", instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]]) or on() max(scylla_io_queue_delay{class="$classes", instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"} ) by ([[by]]))

panels.description: scylla_io_queue_total_exec_sec
panels.title: Disk $classes I/O Queue delay by [[by]]

targets.expr: topk([[topk]], max(scylla_io_queue_disk_queue_length{class="$classes", instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}) by ([[by]])) or on ([[by]]) bottomk([[bottomk]], max(scylla_io_queue_disk_queue_length{class="$classes", instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}) by ([[by]]))

panels.description: scylla_io_queue_disk_queue_length
panels.title: DISK $classes Queue length by [[by]]

targets.expr: topk([[topk]], sum(rate(scylla_io_queue_starvation_time_sec{class="$classes", instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]])) or on ([[by]]) bottomk([[bottomk]], sum(rate(scylla_io_queue_starvation_time_sec{class="$classes", instance=~"[[node]]",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]]))

panels.description:
The time the class waited for being dispatched with non-empty software queue.

Large IO delays coupled with small starvation time denotes that scheduler is doing its job properly, and it's upper layer that overflows disk capacity.

Large IO delays coupled with large starvation time denotes that there might be some problem on the scheduler level that it cannot deliver IO requests from that class into disk in timely manner or the disk is slow and cannot afford timely dispatching.
panels.title: DISK $classes starvation time by [[by]]

panels.content: Information by Task Group

targets.expr: topk([[topk]], $func(rate(scylla_scheduler_runtime_ms{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc",group=~"$sg", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])/1000) by ([[by]])) or on ([[by]]) bottomk([[bottomk]], $func(rate(scylla_scheduler_runtime_ms{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc",group=~"$sg", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])/1000) by ([[by]]))

panels.title: Time used by [[by]] - $sg
panels.description: Scylla employs an event-loop like reactor that alternates between the execution of different groups of tasks periodically. This graph shows how much time was spent in $sg group

targets.expr: topk([[topk]], $func(rate(scylla_scheduler_time_spent_on_task_quota_violations_ms{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc",group=~"$sg", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])/1000) by ([[by]])) or on ([[by]]) bottomk([[bottomk]], $func(rate(scylla_scheduler_time_spent_on_task_quota_violations_ms{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc",group=~"$sg", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])/1000) by ([[by]]))

panels.title: Time spent in task quota violations by [[by]] - $sg
panels.description: Scylla employs an event-loop like reactor that alternates between the execution of different groups of tasks periodically. The maximum amount of time during which a task group can run is called the "task quota". Some task groups may disrespect that and run for longer. This may cause latency issues

targets.expr: topk([[topk]], $func(rate(scylla_scheduler_starvetime_ms{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc",group=~"$sg", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])/1000) by ([[by]])) or on ([[by]]) bottomk([[bottomk]], $func(rate(scylla_scheduler_starvetime_ms{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc",group=~"$sg", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])/1000) by ([[by]]))

panels.title: Starvation time by [[by]] - $sg
panels.description:
Scylla employs an event-loop like reactor that alternates between the execution of different groups of tasks periodically. The maximum amount of time during which a task group can run is called the "task quota". Some task groups may disrespect that and run for longer.

 This graph shows the amount of time the group was waiting to get CPU time.

targets.expr: topk([[topk]], $func(scylla_scheduler_shares{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc",group=~"$sg", shard=~"[[shard]]"}) by ([[by]])) or on ([[by]]) bottomk([[bottomk]], $func(scylla_scheduler_shares{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc",group=~"$sg", shard=~"[[shard]]"}) by ([[by]]))

panels.title: Scheduler shares [[by]] - $sg
panels.description: Shares assigned to the $sg. Shares determine how Scylla reactor distributes the task quotas between groups (Higher share gets more quotas)

targets.expr: topk([[topk]], avg(rate(scylla_storage_proxy_coordinator_read_errors_local_node{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]])) or on ([[by]]) bottomk([[bottomk]], avg(rate(scylla_storage_proxy_coordinator_read_errors_local_node{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]]))

panels.title: Local Reads Error by [[by]]
panels.description: Number of Read requests that failed due to an 'unavailable' error

targets.expr: topk([[topk]], avg(rate(scylla_storage_proxy_coordinator_write_errors_local_node{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]])) or on ([[by]]) bottomk([[bottomk]], avg(rate(scylla_storage_proxy_coordinator_write_errors_local_node{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]]))

panels.title: Local Write Error by [[by]]
panels.description: Number of write requests that failed due to an 'unavailable' error

targets.expr: topk([[topk]], avg(rate(scylla_storage_proxy_coordinator_read_unavailable{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]])) or on ([[by]]) bottomk([[bottomk]], avg(rate(scylla_storage_proxy_coordinator_read_unavailable{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]]))

panels.title: Reads Unavailable Error by [[by]]
panels.description: Number of Read requests that failed due to an 'unavailable' error

targets.expr: topk([[topk]], avg(rate(scylla_storage_proxy_coordinator_write_unavailable{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]])) or on ([[by]]) bottomk([[bottomk]], avg(rate(scylla_storage_proxy_coordinator_write_unavailable{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]]))

panels.title: Write Unavailable Error by [[by]]
panels.description: Number of write requests that failed on a local Node

targets.expr: topk([[topk]], avg(rate(scylla_storage_proxy_coordinator_range_unavailable{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]])) or on ([[by]]) bottomk([[bottomk]], avg(rate(scylla_storage_proxy_coordinator_range_unavailable{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]]))

panels.title: Range Unavailable Error by [[by]]
panels.description: Number of write requests that failed on a local Node

targets.expr: topk([[topk]], avg(rate(scylla_reactor_aio_errors{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]])) or on ([[by]]) bottomk([[bottomk]], avg(rate(scylla_reactor_aio_errors{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]]))

panels.title: AIO Error by [[by]]
panels.description: Number of AIO Errors

targets.expr: topk([[topk]], sum(rate(scylla_reactor_abandoned_failed_futures{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]])) or on ([[by]]) bottomk([[bottomk]], sum(rate(scylla_reactor_abandoned_failed_futures{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]]))

panels.title: Ignored Future By [[by]]
panels.description: Total number of abandoned failed futures, futures destroyed while still containing an exception.

targets.expr: topk([[topk]], sum(rate(scylla_reactor_cpp_exceptions{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]])) or on ([[by]]) bottomk([[bottomk]], sum(rate(scylla_reactor_cpp_exceptions{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]]))

panels.title: C++ Exceptions [[by]]
panels.description:
Number of C++ exceptions thrown.

 An exception by itself does not indicate a problem

targets.expr: topk([[topk]], avg(scylla_commitlog_disk_total_bytes{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}) by ([[by]])) or on ([[by]]) bottomk([[bottomk]], avg(scylla_commitlog_disk_total_bytes{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}) by ([[by]]))

panels.title: Avg reserved disk space by [[by]]
panels.description: Holds the size of disk space in bytes reserved for data so far. A too high value indicates that we have some bottleneck in the writing to sstables path

targets.expr: topk([[topk]], avg(scylla_commitlog_disk_active_bytes{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}) by ([[by]])) or on ([[by]]) bottomk([[bottomk]], avg(scylla_commitlog_disk_active_bytes{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}) by ([[by]]))

panels.title: Avg used disk space by [[by]]
panels.description: Holds the size of disk space in bytes used for data so far. A too high value indicates that we have some bottleneck in the writing to sstables path

targets.expr: topk([[topk]], avg(rate(scylla_commitlog_flush{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]])) or on ([[by]]) bottomk([[bottomk]], avg(rate(scylla_commitlog_flush{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]]))

panels.title: Avg flush by [[by]]
panels.description: Counts a number of times the flush() method was called for a file

targets.expr: topk([[topk]], avg(scylla_commitlog_segments{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}) by ([[by]])) or on ([[by]]) bottomk([[bottomk]], avg(scylla_commitlog_segments{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}) by ([[by]]))

panels.title: Segments by [[by]]
panels.description: Holds the current number of segments

targets.expr: topk([[topk]], avg(rate(scylla_commitlog_flush_limit_exceeded{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]])) or on ([[by]]) bottomk([[bottomk]], avg(rate(scylla_commitlog_flush_limit_exceeded{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]]))

panels.title: Avg flush limit exceeded by [[by]]
panels.description: Counts a number of times a flush limit was exceeded. A non-zero value indicates that there are too many pending flush operations (see pending_flushes) and some of them will be blocked till the total amount of pending flush operations drops below 5.

targets.expr: topk([[topk]], avg(scylla_commitlog_pending_allocations{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}) by ([[by]])) or on ([[by]]) bottomk([[bottomk]], avg(scylla_commitlog_pending_allocations{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}) by ([[by]]))

panels.title: Pending allocations by [[by]]
panels.description: Holds the number of currently pending allocations. A non-zero value indicates that we have a bottleneck in the disk write flow.

targets.expr: topk([[topk]], avg(scylla_commitlog_pending_flushes{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}) by ([[by]])) or on ([[by]]) bottomk([[bottomk]], avg(scylla_commitlog_pending_flushes{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}) by ([[by]]))

panels.title: Pending flush by [[by]]
panels.description: Counts a number of requests blocked due to memory pressure. A non-zero value indicates that the commitlog memory quota is not enough to serve the required amount of requests.

targets.expr: topk([[topk]], avg(scylla_commitlog_unused_segments{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}) by ([[by]])) or on ([[by]]) bottomk([[bottomk]], avg(scylla_commitlog_unused_segments{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}) by ([[by]]))

panels.title: Unused segments by [[by]]
panels.description: Holds the current number of unused segments. A non-zero value indicates that the disk write path became temporary slow.

targets.expr: topk([[topk]], avg(scylla_commitlog_allocating_segments{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}) by ([[by]])) or on ([[by]]) bottomk([[bottomk]], avg(scylla_commitlog_allocating_segments{instance=~"[[node]]" ,cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]"}) by ([[by]]))

panels.title: Allocating segments by [[by]]
panels.description: Holds the number of not closed segments that still have some free space. This value should not get too high.

targets.expr: topk([[topk]], sum(scylla_rpc_client_count{instance=~"[[node]]|^$",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^"}) by ([[by]],domain)>0) or on ([[by]],domain) bottomk([[bottomk]], sum(scylla_rpc_client_count{instance=~"[[node]]|^$",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^"}) by ([[by]],domain)>0)

panels.description: scylla_rpc_client_count
panels.title: RPC Client count by [[by]]

targets.expr: topk([[topk]], sum(rate(scylla_rpc_client_sent_messages{instance=~"[[node]]|^$",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^"}[$__rate_interval])>0) by ([[by]],domain)) or on ([[by]],domain) bottomk([[bottomk]], sum(rate(scylla_rpc_client_sent_messages{instance=~"[[node]]|^$",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]],domain)>0)

panels.description: scylla_rpc_client_sent_messages
panels.title: RPC sent messages by [[by]]

targets.expr: topk([[topk]], sum(rate(scylla_rpc_client_replied{instance=~"[[node]]|^$",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^"}[$__rate_interval])>0) by ([[by]],domain)) or on ([[by]],domain) bottomk([[bottomk]], sum(rate(scylla_rpc_client_replied{instance=~"[[node]]|^$",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]],domain)>0)

panels.description: scylla_rpc_client_replied
panels.title: RPC replied messages by [[by]]

targets.expr: topk([[topk]], sum(rate(scylla_rpc_client_exception_received{instance=~"[[node]]|^$",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^"}[$__rate_interval])>0) by ([[by]],domain)) or on ([[by]],domain) bottomk([[bottomk]], sum(rate(scylla_rpc_client_exception_received{instance=~"[[node]]|^$",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]],domain)>0)

panels.description: scylla_rpc_client_exception_received
panels.title: RPC exceptional replied messages by [[by]]

targets.expr: topk([[topk]], sum(rate(scylla_rpc_client_timeout{instance=~"[[node]]|^$",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^"}[$__rate_interval])>0) by ([[by]],domain)) or on ([[by]],domain) bottomk([[bottomk]], sum(rate(scylla_rpc_client_timeout{instance=~"[[node]]|^$",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^"}[$__rate_interval])) by ([[by]],domain)>0)

panels.description: scylla_rpc_client_timeout
panels.title: RPC requests timeout by [[by]]

targets.expr: topk([[topk]], sum(scylla_rpc_client_pending{instance=~"[[node]]|^$",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^"}) by ([[by]],domain)>0) or on ([[by]],domain) bottomk([[bottomk]], sum(scylla_rpc_client_pending{instance=~"[[node]]|^$",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^"}) by ([[by]],domain)>0)

panels.description:
the number of requests queued for sending, but not yet sent

scylla_rpc_client_pending
panels.title: RPC Pending Messages by [[by]]

targets.expr: topk([[topk]], sum(scylla_rpc_client_wait_reply{instance=~"[[node]]|^$",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^"}) by ([[by]],domain)>0) or on ([[by]],domain) bottomk([[bottomk]], sum(scylla_rpc_client_wait_reply{instance=~"[[node]]|^$",cluster="$cluster", dc=~"$dc", shard=~"[[shard]]|$^"}) by ([[by]],domain)>0)

panels.description:
the number of requests waiting for the reply

scylla_rpc_client_wait_reply
panels.title: RPC Wait for Reply by [[by]]
